org.xamjwg.platform
Class PlatformAccess

java.lang.Object
  org.xamjwg.platform.PlatformAccess

public class PlatformAccess
extends Object

Platform access utilities. This class is a singleton. Instantiate by calling PlatformAccess.getInstance().

Since:
0.93.2
See Also:
getInstance()

Method Detail

getInstance

public static PlatformAccess getInstance()
Gets the PlatformAccess singleton.

launch

public void launch()
Launches the default browser application. It tries to reuse any existing platform JVM. The method initPlatform should not be invoked when this method is used.

See Also:
launchLocal(java.lang.String[])

launch

public void launch(String[] urls)
Launches the URLs given. Documents are normally opened in a browser frame, unless they include a document-disposition of auto or window. This method attempts to reuse any existing platform JVMs. The method initPlatform should not be invoked when this method is used.

Parameters:
urls - An array of URLs to open.
See Also:
launchLocal(java.lang.String[])

initPlatform

public void initPlatform()
                  throws Exception
Sets up a security policy, default Look & Feel, and standard output redirection to console. Implementations that do not care about security do not need to call this before calling launchLocal. This is implicitly called if using one of the launch methods, however.

Throws:
Exception
See Also:
launchLocal(java.lang.String[])

launchLocal

public void launchLocal(String[] urls)
                 throws MalformedURLException
Launches the platform without setting up security or a default look & feel, and without reusing any existing platform JVM. Documents are normally opened in a browser frame, unless they include a document-disposition of auto or window.

Parameters:
urls - An array of URLs to open.
Throws:
MalformedURLException
See Also:
initPlatform(), createFrame()

createHostPermission

public Permission createHostPermission(String hostName)
Systems that set their own security policy (not invoking initPlatform) should use this method to create a permission needed to access managed stores.

Parameters:
hostName - The name of the host the code was loaded from.
Returns:
A Permission object which may be used in a security Policy.
See Also:
initPlatform()

createHostPermission

public Permission createHostPermission(URL url)
Systems that set their own security policy (not invoking initPlatform) should use this method to create a permission needed to access managed stores.

Parameters:
url - The URL the code was loaded from.
Returns:
A Permission object which may be used in a security Policy.
See Also:
initPlatform()

createFrame

public XFrameElement createFrame()
Creates a browser frame widget (not to be confused with a Swing window.) The frame can then be used to load documents. It can be embedded in a Swing/AWT application with the help of the getComponent method. Invoking initPlatform beforehand is recommended but not necessary.

See Also:
getComponent(XWidgetElement), addXamjListener(org.xamjwg.dom.XElement, java.lang.String, org.xamjwg.event.XamjListener)

requestComponent

public AsyncResult<Component> requestComponent(String url)
                                        throws ClientletException,
                                               MalformedURLException
Asynchronously requests a XAMJ document from the given URL. This method returns an object that accepts listeners which can receive the resulting lightweight component asynchronously. These listeners will receive the component in the AWT dispatch thread. Note that when this component is added to a parent component, the parent may need to be revalidated.

Returns:
An AsyncResult that receives an instance of java.awt.Component.
Throws:
ClientletException
MalformedURLException

addXamjListener

public void addXamjListener(XElement element,
                            String eventName,
                            XamjListener listener)
                     throws XamjException
Shortcut to add event+action children to a XAMJ element. This could be used to listen on frame events, for example.

Parameters:
element - A XAMJ element.
eventName - The name of the event, e.g. on-property-change.
listener - A XamjListener instance, which receives event notifications.
Throws:
ClientletException - Thrown if eventName is invalid.
XamjException

getComponent

public Component getComponent(XWidgetElement welement)
Gets an instance of java.awt.Component corresponding to a XAMJ widget element. This can be used to embed platform frames or top-level XAMJ document widgets in a Swing/AWT application.

Parameters:
welement - A widget element instance.
See Also:
createFrame()

getComponents

public Component[] getComponents(XWidgetElement[] welement)
Gets an instance of java.awt.Component corresponding to a XAMJ widget element. This can be used to embed platform frames or top-level XAMJ document widgets in a Swing/AWT application.

Parameters:
welement - A widget element instance.
See Also:
createFrame()

addClientletSelector

public void addClientletSelector(ClientletSelector selector)
Adds a ClientletSelector which allows the platform to process additional content types. The platform itself registers one or more selectors internally in order to handle XAMJ and other content types. These cannot be overridden.

Parameters:
selector - A ClientletSelector instance.
See Also:
ClientletSelector
